metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29947 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mozilla developers and community members reported memory safety bugspresent in Firefox 87. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memorycorruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could havebeen exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox <88.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29947` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '88.0+build2-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in esm-apps/focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
